subject: Photography
title: RAW vs. JPEG: The Great Debate
description: A quick win: understand RAW vs. JPEG: The Great Debate.

hook.text: JPEG is a finished meal. RAW is fresh ingredients. One is ready to eat. The other is ready to cook.

buildup.text: JPEG files are processed in-camera: compressed, sharpened, color-adjusted. They're small and ready to share.

discovery.text: RAW files retain all sensor data â€” unprocessed, uncompressed. They require editing but offer vastly more flexibility.

twist.text: A blown-out sky in JPEG is gone forever. In RAW, you can often recover detail that looked completely lost.

climax.text: Professional photographers shoot RAW for control. Casual shooters use JPEG for convenience. Both are valid.

punchline.text: JPEG decides for you. RAW lets you decide later.

quiz.question: Why can RAW files recover detail that JPEG cannot?
options: RAW retains all sensor data unprocessed while JPEG discards data during compression
